The '''Rangers of Ithilien''' were a company of [[Gondorians|Gondorian]] soldiers, selected from the descendants of the people who had dwelt in [[Ithilien]] before it fell from [[Gondor]]'s control.<ref name="Herbs">{{TT|Herbs}}, p. 659</ref> At the time of the [[War of the Ring]] they crossed the [[Anduin]] dressed in camouflaging green and brown, with green gauntlets and green hoods and masks, armed with great bows, which were almost as high as themselves with great quivers with long arrows with green feathers or spears with broad bright heads and swords to harass the forces of the Enemy in Gondor's old domain<ref>{{TT|Herbs}}, p. 656</ref><ref name="Attack">{{TT|Herbs}}, p. 660</ref> and used several secret retreats in the region.<ref name="Stewards">{{App|Stewards}}, entry for Steward Túrin II, p. 1054</ref>

==History==
It is likely that the Rangers of Ithilien were established at the same time that [[Henneth Annûn]] was built, in {{TA|2901}} when most of the remaining inhabitants of the region departed due to [[Uruk-hai|Uruk]] attacks from [[Mordor]]<ref>{{App|TA}}, entry for the year 2901, p. 1088</ref> during the reign of [[Steward of Gondor|Steward]] [[Túrin II]].<ref>{{App|South}}, ''Ruling Stewards'', entries for Thorondir and Túrin II, p. 1039</ref> Steward Túrin II had secret refugees, such as Henneth Annûn, built in Ithilien for his soldiers.<ref name="Stewards"/> The Rangers' main task seems to have been to harry [[Sauron]]'s forces whenever they entered Ithilien.

At the time of the [[War of the Ring]] the leader of these Rangers was [[Faramir]], son of the [[Ruling Steward]] [[Denethor]].<ref name="Herbs"/> Other Rangers at that time were [[Damrod]], [[Mablung (ranger of Ithilien)|Mablung]],<ref name="Herbs"/> and [[Anborn]].<ref>{{TT|Window}}, p. 675</ref>

On [[7 March]] {{TA|3019|n}}, [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]] and [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]] were captured by Faramir and other Rangers<ref name="Herbs"/> and witnessed a harassing attack by the Rangers of Ithilien upon a regiment of [[Haradrim|Southrons]] marching north.<ref name="Attack"/> After the battle Faramir learned of the [[The One Ring|One Ring]] carried by Frodo<ref>{{TT|Window}}, pp. 664-71</ref> and the two hobbits were taken to Henneth Annûn by Faramir and the Rangers.<ref>{{TT|Window}}, p. 674</ref><ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 7, p. 1093</ref> There the Rangers captured [[Gollum]] at the [[Forbidden Pool]],<ref>{{TT|Pool}}, p. 685</ref> but on [[8 March]]<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 8, p. 1093</ref> he let the three go to seek entry into Mordor.<ref>{{TT|Journey}}, p. 694</ref>

Faramir and the Rangers of Ithilien left Henneth Annûn on [[9 March]].<ref>{{App|Great}}, entry for the year 3019, March 9, p. 1093</ref> When the [[Army of the West]] marched through Ithilien on its way to the [[Morannon]], a powerful force of [[Orcs]] and [[Easterlings]] tried to ambush its leading companies, but the Rangers of Ithilien, led by Mablung (since Faramir was recovering in the [[Houses of Healing]]) trapped the ambushers and destroyed them.<ref>{{RK|Gate}}, p. 885</ref>

==Legacy==
After the defeat of [[Sauron]], it is possible that the Rangers of Ithilien may have become the [[White Company]], the guard of Faramir, who became the [[Prince of Ithilien]] at the command of King [[Aragorn|Elessar]].<ref>{{HM|Guide}}, p. 326, entry '''Rangers of Ithilien'''. p. 325-26</ref>
